pullRequest.body:
We add various result about the norm, relative to `ℤ`, of `ζ - 1`. These results already exist for the norm relative to `ℚ`.

From the flt3 project at LFTCM2024.

- [x] depends on: #12386

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: The new stuff in `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.Rat` alone needs > 5 seconds for typeclass inference.
@erdOne what happened to your work to speed up ring of integers?

@MichaelStollBayreuth in [6bdb8f3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11792/commits/6bdb8f3ddc83a6f86df9f8df984614a82ff7c506) I've added a couple of instances to speed up the file, but is this really what you are proposing? I can of course keep going and help Lean everywhere, but it seems a little arbitrary to me.

In principle we can do this everywhere... do you think this file is particularly slow? It doesn't seem to me, but I can be wrong.

@riccardobrasca This file takes about half a minute to compile on my machine (I took the version from your branch). It is in the top 120 slow files (by "instructions") within Mathlib. So there are many slower files, but it is still among the slow ones.
Adding the following instances:
```lean
@[local instance] private def instAlg : Algebra ℤ (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) :=
  Subalgebra.algebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
@[local instance] private def instAlg' : Algebra (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) K :=
  Subalgebra.toAlgebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
@[local instance] private def instFinite : Finite ({p ^ k} : Set ℕ+) := Finite.of_fintype _
@[local instance] private def instNontrivial_K : Nontrivial K := ⟨0, 1, zero_ne_one⟩
@[local instance] private noncomputable def instModule_cyc :
    Module (CyclotomicRing (p ^ k) ℤ ℚ) (CyclotomicField (p ^ k) ℚ) := toModule
@[local instance] private def instAlg'' : Algebra ℤ (𝓞 K) := Subalgebra.algebra (𝓞 K)
@[local instance] private def instAlg''' : Algebra (𝓞 K) K := Subalgebra.toAlgebra _
@[local instance] private lemma instPID_Int : IsPrincipalIdealRing ℤ :=
  EuclideanDomain.to_principal_ideal_domain
@[local instance] private lemma instIntegrallyClosed_Int : IsIntegrallyClosed ℤ :=
  UniqueFactorizationMonoid.instIsIntegrallyClosed
@[local instance] private def instAddCommGroup [NumberField K] : AddCommGroup ↥(𝓞 K) :=
  Ring.toAddCommGroup
@[local instance] private def instModFin [NumberField K] : Module.Finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K) :=
  Module.IsNoetherian.finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K)
@[local instance] private def instAMHC : AddMonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
  RingHomClass.toAddMonoidHomClass
@[local instance] private def instMHC : MonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
  RingHomClass.toMonoidHomClass
```
(in line 35, after the `variable` statement and before `namespace IsCyclotomicExtension.Rat`) and squeezing most `simp(a)`s (some of which also cause unnecessary slow instance searches) cuts it down by a factor of about 2 (typeclass inference goes down from 25.1 s to 10.8 s). If we could do this with all the slow files with similar effect, Mathlib would compile quite a bit faster...

There are also a few slow `convert`s (the first one in `absdiscr_prime_pow` takes more than half a second).

It is probably a good idea to have a broader discussion about this on Zulip...

> @riccardobrasca This file takes about half a minute to compile on my machine (I took the version from your branch). It is in the top 120 slow files (by "instructions") within Mathlib. So there are many slower files, but it is still among the slow ones. Adding the following instances:
> 
> ```lean
> @[local instance] private def instAlg : Algebra ℤ (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) :=
>   Subalgebra.algebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
> @[local instance] private def instAlg' : Algebra (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) K :=
>   Subalgebra.toAlgebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
> @[local instance] private def instFinite : Finite ({p ^ k} : Set ℕ+) := Finite.of_fintype _
> @[local instance] private def instNontrivial_K : Nontrivial K := ⟨0, 1, zero_ne_one⟩
> @[local instance] private noncomputable def instModule_cyc :
>     Module (CyclotomicRing (p ^ k) ℤ ℚ) (CyclotomicField (p ^ k) ℚ) := toModule
> @[local instance] private def instAlg'' : Algebra ℤ (𝓞 K) := Subalgebra.algebra (𝓞 K)
> @[local instance] private def instAlg''' : Algebra (𝓞 K) K := Subalgebra.toAlgebra _
> @[local instance] private lemma instPID_Int : IsPrincipalIdealRing ℤ :=
>   EuclideanDomain.to_principal_ideal_domain
> @[local instance] private lemma instIntegrallyClosed_Int : IsIntegrallyClosed ℤ :=
>   UniqueFactorizationMonoid.instIsIntegrallyClosed
> @[local instance] private def instAddCommGroup [NumberField K] : AddCommGroup ↥(𝓞 K) :=
>   Ring.toAddCommGroup
> @[local instance] private def instModFin [NumberField K] : Module.Finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K) :=
>   Module.IsNoetherian.finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K)
> @[local instance] private def instAMHC : AddMonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
>   RingHomClass.toAddMonoidHomClass
> @[local instance] private def instMHC : MonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
>   RingHomClass.toMonoidHomClass
> ```
> 
> (in line 35, after the `variable` statement and before `namespace IsCyclotomicExtension.Rat`) and squeezing most `simp(a)`s (some of which also cause unnecessary slow instance searches) cuts it down by a factor of about 2 (typeclass inference goes down from 25.1 s to 10.8 s). If we could do this with all the slow files with similar effect, Mathlib would compile quite a bit faster...
> 
> There are also a few slow `convert`s (the first one in `absdiscr_prime_pow` takes more than half a second).
> 
> It is probably a good idea to have a broader discussion about this on Zulip...

These surely help, thanks.

I agree that a general discussion on zulip would be better, for example we can maybe have a linter looking for slow simp/convert or whatever, and decide a global limit over which doing manual intervention.

Code looks good overall, I just would like to try and clean up the proofs a bit more. I'll leave it to your judgement whether my proposed `norm_toInteger_eq_iff` is really an improvement.

bors d+

Code looks good overall, I just would like to try and clean up the proofs a bit more. I'll leave it to your judgement whether my proposed `norm_toInteger_eq_iff` is really an improvement.

bors d+
I think the name should be more like `norm_toInteger_pow_sub_one_of_prime_pow_ne_two` (and similarly for the others and the already existing ones).
Done, thanks.
This still leaves `IsPrimitiveRoot.pow_sub_one_norm_prime_pow_ne_two` and friends, which should also be changed to `IsPrimitiveRoot.norm_pow_sub_one_of_prime_pow_ne_two` etc.
Done, thanks.

Using
```lean
set_option profiler true
set_option profiler.threshold 50
```
I see
```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 84.9ms
typeclass inference of Finite took 74.7ms
typeclass inference of NonUnitalSemiring took 52.3ms
typeclass inference of AddMonoidHomClass took 271ms
typeclass inference of MonoidHomClass took 151ms
typeclass inference of Algebra took 82.1ms
typeclass inference of Algebra took 59.8ms
typeclass inference of Module.Finite took 298ms
tactic execution of Lean.Parser.Tactic.rewriteSeq took 87.1ms
type checking took 71.2ms
```
See also below for some of the other declarations.
Maybe adding a few carefully chosen private local instances can speed up the file by quite a bit?
See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/defLemma.20and.20docBlame.20linters.20on.20local.20instances.20in.20sections/near/433829610) for how to avoid triggering the linters.

```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 78.7ms
typeclass inference of Finite took 79.3ms
typeclass inference of AddMonoidHomClass took 246ms
typeclass inference of MonoidHomClass took 133ms
typeclass inference of Algebra took 74.3ms
typeclass inference of Algebra took 56.9ms
typeclass inference of Module.Finite took 286ms
tactic execution of Lean.Parser.Tactic.rewriteSeq took 89.8ms
type checking took 68.3ms
```

```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 98.2ms
```

```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 94.4ms
typeclass inference of AddGroup took 51.7ms
typeclass inference of NonUnitalSemiring took 56.5ms
typeclass inference of AddMonoidHomClass took 282ms
simp took 87.1ms
simp took 168ms
```

```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 81.6ms
```

```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 79.1ms
```

```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 84.1ms
```

```
typeclass inference of Algebra took 79.8ms
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```
I guess this is for consistency with the `prime_ne_two` names, but `of_eq_two` doesn't really make sense
Ah yes, let's keep `two`.
Should this be `norm_pow_sub_one_eq_prime_pow_of_ne_zero`?
Same comment about `of_eq_two`

If you're going to split the line, I suggest
```suggestion
    Prime hζ.subOneIntegralPowerBasis.gen := by
  simpa only [subOneIntegralPowerBasis_gen] using hζ.zeta_sub_one_prime
```

```suggestion
    Prime hζ.subOneIntegralPowerBasis'.gen := by
  simpa only [subOneIntegralPowerBasis'_gen] using hζ.zeta_sub_one_prime'
```

```suggestion
    simp only [map_sub, map_pow, map_one, sub_left_inj, RingOfIntegers.map_mk]
```

This seems a little clearer to me; alternatively you could move the `norm_pow_sub_one_of_prime_pow_ne_two` call into a separate `have` as well
```suggestion
  rw [← Algebra.norm_localization (Sₘ := K) ℤ ℤ⁰, this,
    hζ.norm_pow_sub_one_of_prime_pow_ne_two
      (cyclotomic.irreducible_rat (by simp only [PNat.pow_coe, gt_iff_lt, PNat.pos, pow_pos]))
      hs htwo]
```

```suggestion
    simp only [map_sub, map_pow, map_one, sub_left_inj, RingOfIntegers.map_mk]
```

```suggestion
  rw [← Algebra.norm_localization (Sₘ := K) ℤ ℤ⁰, this,
    hζ.norm_pow_sub_one_of_eq_two (cyclotomic.irreducible_rat (pow_pos (by decide) _))]
```

This could also be
```suggestion
  apply hodd
  simp [← PNat.coe_inj, eq_of_prime_pow_eq hp.out.prime Nat.prime_two.prime (k - s).succ_pos h]
```

```suggestion
    (hζ : IsPrimitiveRoot ζ ↑(p ^ (k + 1))) (htwo : p ^ (k + 1) ≠ 2) :
```

So the reader can recognize it better, let's put the `using` on a separate line.
```suggestion
        pow_zero]
      using hζ.norm_pow_sub_one_two (cyclotomic.irreducible_rat
        (by simp only [Nat.zero_eq, zero_add, pow_one, Nat.ofNat_pos]))
```

Maybe we should extract the following proof step into its own lemma? The only thing that I would like to add is somehow turning `hζ` into `ζ` in the new lemma, but I don't think there's a good way to do so. (I think the statement is also generalizable quite a bit, didn't put much effort in.)
```suggestion
open nonZeroDivisors in
/-- The norm of `hζ : 𝓞 K` in `ℤ` can be computed in `ℚ`. -/
lemma norm_toInteger_eq_iff [IsCyclotomicExtension {p ^ (k + 1)} ℚ K]
    (hζ : IsPrimitiveRoot ζ ↑(p ^ (k + 1))) {f : 𝓞 K → 𝓞 K} {y : ℤ} :
    Algebra.norm ℤ (f hζ.toInteger) = y ↔
      (Algebra.norm ℚ) ((algebraMap (𝓞 K) K) (f hζ.toInteger)) = ↑y := by
  have : NumberField K := IsCyclotomicExtension.numberField {p ^ (k + 1)} ℚ K
  rw [← (algebraMap ℤ ℚ).injective_int.eq_iff, ← Algebra.norm_localization (Sₘ := K) ℤ ℤ⁰,
      eq_intCast]

/-- The norm, relative to `ℤ`, of `ζ ^ p ^ s - 1` in a `p ^ (k + 1)`-th cyclotomic extension of `ℚ`
is p ^ p ^ s` if `s ≤ k` and `p ^ (k - s + 1) ≠ 2`. -/
lemma norm_toInteger_pow_sub_one_of_prime_pow_ne_two [IsCyclotomicExtension {p ^ (k + 1)} ℚ K]
    (hζ : IsPrimitiveRoot ζ ↑(p ^ (k + 1))) {s : ℕ} (hs : s ≤ k) (htwo : p ^ (k - s + 1) ≠ 2) :
    Algebra.norm ℤ (hζ.toInteger ^ (p : ℕ) ^ s - 1) = p ^ (p : ℕ) ^ s := by
  rw [norm_toInteger_eq_iff (f := fun x => x ^ (p : ℕ) ^ s - 1)]
  simp [hζ.norm_pow_sub_one_of_prime_pow_ne_two
          (cyclotomic.irreducible_rat (by simp only [PNat.pow_coe, gt_iff_lt, PNat.pos, pow_pos]))
          hs htwo]

/-- The norm, relative to `ℤ`, of `ζ ^ 2 ^ k - 1` in a `2 ^ (k + 1)`-th cyclotomic extension of `ℚ`
is `(-2) ^ 2 ^ k`. -/
lemma norm_toInteger_pow_sub_one_of_two [IsCyclotomicExtension {2 ^ (k + 1)} ℚ K]
    (hζ : IsPrimitiveRoot ζ ↑((2 : ℕ+) ^ (k + 1))) :
    Algebra.norm ℤ (hζ.toInteger ^ 2 ^ k - 1) = (-2) ^ (2 : ℕ) ^ k := by
  rw [norm_toInteger_eq_iff (f := fun x => x ^ 2 ^ k - 1)]
  simp [hζ.norm_pow_sub_one_two (cyclotomic.irreducible_rat (pow_pos (by decide) _))]
```
`norm_toInteger_eq_iff` looks a reasonable idea, but it has nothing to do with cyclotomic fields. I will move it where it should be probably tomorrow, thanks!

I tried to use more general tactics so we wouldn't have to manually rewrite all the coercions. It's not a great golf but at least it's a bit less thinking.
```suggestion
  refine hζ.norm_toInteger_pow_sub_one_of_prime_pow_ne_two hs (fun h ↦ hodd ?_)
  suffices h : (p : ℕ) = 2 from PNat.coe_injective h
  apply eq_of_prime_pow_eq hp.out.prime Nat.prime_two.prime (k - s).succ_pos
  rw [pow_one]
  exact_mod_cast congr_arg Subtype.val h
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hM : M ≤ nonZeroDivisors R) : Algebra.norm R a = b ↔ ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - Feat: add various result about the norm, relative to `ℤ`, of `ζ - 1`.

nodes.body: The new stuff in `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.Rat` alone needs > 5 seconds for typeclass inference.
@erdOne what happened to your work to speed up ring of integers?

@MichaelStollBayreuth in [6bdb8f3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11792/commits/6bdb8f3ddc83a6f86df9f8df984614a82ff7c506) I've added a couple of instances to speed up the file, but is this really what you are proposing? I can of course keep going and help Lean everywhere, but it seems a little arbitrary to me.

In principle we can do this everywhere... do you think this file is particularly slow? It doesn't seem to me, but I can be wrong.

@riccardobrasca This file takes about half a minute to compile on my machine (I took the version from your branch). It is in the top 120 slow files (by "instructions") within Mathlib. So there are many slower files, but it is still among the slow ones.
Adding the following instances:
```lean
@[local instance] private def instAlg : Algebra ℤ (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) :=
  Subalgebra.algebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
@[local instance] private def instAlg' : Algebra (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) K :=
  Subalgebra.toAlgebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
@[local instance] private def instFinite : Finite ({p ^ k} : Set ℕ+) := Finite.of_fintype _
@[local instance] private def instNontrivial_K : Nontrivial K := ⟨0, 1, zero_ne_one⟩
@[local instance] private noncomputable def instModule_cyc :
    Module (CyclotomicRing (p ^ k) ℤ ℚ) (CyclotomicField (p ^ k) ℚ) := toModule
@[local instance] private def instAlg'' : Algebra ℤ (𝓞 K) := Subalgebra.algebra (𝓞 K)
@[local instance] private def instAlg''' : Algebra (𝓞 K) K := Subalgebra.toAlgebra _
@[local instance] private lemma instPID_Int : IsPrincipalIdealRing ℤ :=
  EuclideanDomain.to_principal_ideal_domain
@[local instance] private lemma instIntegrallyClosed_Int : IsIntegrallyClosed ℤ :=
  UniqueFactorizationMonoid.instIsIntegrallyClosed
@[local instance] private def instAddCommGroup [NumberField K] : AddCommGroup ↥(𝓞 K) :=
  Ring.toAddCommGroup
@[local instance] private def instModFin [NumberField K] : Module.Finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K) :=
  Module.IsNoetherian.finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K)
@[local instance] private def instAMHC : AddMonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
  RingHomClass.toAddMonoidHomClass
@[local instance] private def instMHC : MonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
  RingHomClass.toMonoidHomClass
```
(in line 35, after the `variable` statement and before `namespace IsCyclotomicExtension.Rat`) and squeezing most `simp(a)`s (some of which also cause unnecessary slow instance searches) cuts it down by a factor of about 2 (typeclass inference goes down from 25.1 s to 10.8 s). If we could do this with all the slow files with similar effect, Mathlib would compile quite a bit faster...

There are also a few slow `convert`s (the first one in `absdiscr_prime_pow` takes more than half a second).

It is probably a good idea to have a broader discussion about this on Zulip...

> @riccardobrasca This file takes about half a minute to compile on my machine (I took the version from your branch). It is in the top 120 slow files (by "instructions") within Mathlib. So there are many slower files, but it is still among the slow ones. Adding the following instances:
> 
> ```lean
> @[local instance] private def instAlg : Algebra ℤ (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) :=
>   Subalgebra.algebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
> @[local instance] private def instAlg' : Algebra (adjoin ℤ ({ζ} : Set K)) K :=
>   Subalgebra.toAlgebra (adjoin ℤ {ζ})
> @[local instance] private def instFinite : Finite ({p ^ k} : Set ℕ+) := Finite.of_fintype _
> @[local instance] private def instNontrivial_K : Nontrivial K := ⟨0, 1, zero_ne_one⟩
> @[local instance] private noncomputable def instModule_cyc :
>     Module (CyclotomicRing (p ^ k) ℤ ℚ) (CyclotomicField (p ^ k) ℚ) := toModule
> @[local instance] private def instAlg'' : Algebra ℤ (𝓞 K) := Subalgebra.algebra (𝓞 K)
> @[local instance] private def instAlg''' : Algebra (𝓞 K) K := Subalgebra.toAlgebra _
> @[local instance] private lemma instPID_Int : IsPrincipalIdealRing ℤ :=
>   EuclideanDomain.to_principal_ideal_domain
> @[local instance] private lemma instIntegrallyClosed_Int : IsIntegrallyClosed ℤ :=
>   UniqueFactorizationMonoid.instIsIntegrallyClosed
> @[local instance] private def instAddCommGroup [NumberField K] : AddCommGroup ↥(𝓞 K) :=
>   Ring.toAddCommGroup
> @[local instance] private def instModFin [NumberField K] : Module.Finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K) :=
>   Module.IsNoetherian.finite ℤ ↥(𝓞 K)
> @[local instance] private def instAMHC : AddMonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
>   RingHomClass.toAddMonoidHomClass
> @[local instance] private def instMHC : MonoidHomClass (↥(𝓞 K) →+* K) (↥(𝓞 K)) K :=
>   RingHomClass.toMonoidHomClass
> ```
> 
> (in line 35, after the `variable` statement and before `namespace IsCyclotomicExtension.Rat`) and squeezing most `simp(a)`s (some of which also cause unnecessary slow instance searches) cuts it down by a factor of about 2 (typeclass inference goes down from 25.1 s to 10.8 s). If we could do this with all the slow files with similar effect, Mathlib would compile quite a bit faster...
> 
> There are also a few slow `convert`s (the first one in `absdiscr_prime_pow` takes more than half a second).
> 
> It is probably a good idea to have a broader discussion about this on Zulip...

These surely help, thanks.

I agree that a general discussion on zulip would be better, for example we can maybe have a linter looking for slow simp/convert or whatever, and decide a global limit over which doing manual intervention.
